jobDescription: "Job Description: Occupational Therapist (OTR)Requirements: Bachelor of Science Degree in Occupational Therapy. State Licensure.Supervision: Occupational Therapist is responsible for overseeing direct clinical skills, documentation skills, and the compliance to all professional standards. The Occupational Therapist is responsible for supervising the Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant. The OT will report to the Regional Manager for Paid Time Off approval, staffing, daily facility and corporate operations.Job Description:  The OTR is responsible for the evaluation and treatment of residents who demonstrate disorders or neurological deficit, weakness, and paralysis. Evaluation and treatment will only be conducted after a written order is received from the physician. The OTR is responsible for the screening of residents of the facility: The OTR is responsible for the completion of all necessary documentation, (All documentation will be co-signed by the OTR) The OTR is responsible for attending all required facility meetings and in-services, including Medicare meetings, patient staffings, family meetings, care plans. The OTR will in cooperation with the Program Manager and the Regional Manager, develop programs appropriate to the needs of the residents in the facility, to assist them in achieving their highest feasible level of functioning. The OTR will assist the facility in meeting the standards necessary to obtain state, federal, and other appropriate certification. The OTR will employ and follow all appropriate facility infection control policies and procedures and will respect and follow OBRA Residents Rights Guidelines. The OTR is responsible for the appropriate scheduling of residents on caseload in addition to all required in-services and meetings. The OTR will contact the Regional Manager if productivity levels consistently fall below or exceed the standard to indicate the need for additional staffing or the need for assistance in screening and identifying residents in need of OT services. The OTR is responsible for the scheduling and completing of in-services for facility staff education. The OTR will present her/himself in a professional manner at all times including professional conduct, professional communication, and appropriate dress while in the facility. Other duties as assigned."
